column16: Then Indra, Lord of the Gods sent four brave and strong divine sons as bodyguards for the Bodhisattva while he was in residing in the womb: Khadgapani, Shulapani, Tomarapani, and Shaktipani.
column18: Four young gods holding weapons protect the bodhisattva while he resides in the womb
column19: ཡང་དེ་དག་དང་ཉེ་བའི་ཁང་བཟང་གཅིག་ཏུ། ཡུམ་གྱི་སྐུའི་ལྟོ་བ་ན། བྱང་ཆུབ་སེམས་དཔའ་ལྷུམས་སུ་ཞུགས་པ་ནི། ལྷའི་སྐུ་འདྲ་བ་འོད་ཟེར་འཕྲོ་བས་བརྒྱན་པ་དང་། ཡུམ་གྱི་སྐུ་གཡས་གཡོན་དུ་ལྷའི་བགྲུང་མ་བཞི། རལ་གྲི་དང་། མདུང་དང་། མདུང་ཐུང་དང་། མདའ་བོ་ཆེ་རྣམས་འཛིན་པ་ཡོད་པ།  འཁོར་གཡོག་མང་པོ་མཆོད་པ་སྣ་ཚོགས་པའི་རྣམ་པ་འབྲིའོ། །དེ་ནས་རྒྱལ་པོས་བཙོན་རྣམས་བཏང་བ་དང། ཀུན་ཏུ་རྒྱུ་མིག་དམར་ཞེས་བྱ་བ། ད་ལྟའི་སཱ་བྱ་ཤིའི་ཆ་ལུགས་འདྲ་བ་ཅིག་གིས། རྒྱ་མཚོ་བཞིའི་ཆུ་ཡུམ་ལ་འདྲེན་པའི་རྣམ་པ་རྣམས་འདྲིའོ། །རྒྱལ་པོ་ཟ་གཙང་མ་ཡང་དེ་གཉིས་ན་ཉེ་བ་ན་བཞུགས་པ་རེ་བྱ།
column20: In a mansion near the king's palace, the Buddha, like a god emanating rays of light and wearing jewelry, enters the womb of the queen. The queen is surrounded by four protector gods holding a sword, spear, short spear, and large arrows, respectively. A large retinue make various offerings. The king sets free his prisoners. A yogi or wanderer known as Lohita (mig dmar), resembling a Sāchashi (sA bya shi) follower today, offers water from the four seas to the mother. King Śuddhodana (zas gtsang ma) dwells near them.

Sun of Faith - English: Even while residing in his mother's womb, he was not defilied by impurities.
Like a five-colored thread embeddeed in the center of a beryl stone, his perfect young body endowed with wondrous signs was clearly visible without obstruction from the outside of her body.
From that time, for as long as she lived, the mother maintained the five precepts.
Her thoughts were not focused on desires.
Maya Devi stayed in the palace gardens with every conceivable material comfort. Every cause for suffering and unhappiness was banished. She lived like a divine daughter in a paradise.
Once she experienced a craving to drink water from the four oceans.
She told the King, and he asked his diviners.
“This is due to the one residing in her womb. It means that he will drink the ocean of knowledge.”
"And what will happen if she does not drink such waters?” the king asked.
“The child will be born with incomplete limbs.”
The king thought, “How could I, Shuddhodana, let my son have incomplete limbs?”
He called for the itinerant Lohita, who was expert at casting magical spells.
The four oceans appeared as a result of his spells.
Inscription - English: Offering waters of the four oceans

Sun of Faith - English: She drank their waters and was satiated.
Likewise, when [Mahamaya Devi] wished that the prisoners would be freed, the king set them free.
When she wished to satisfy many people through giving alms, the King did just that.
And when craved to do things such as see their many gardens, the King acted accordingly.
